bosk.comparison#

Deep Forest based model comparison module.

It is useful for performance and quality evaluation and comparison of Deep Forest models between each other and with third-party models.

Besides cross-validated evaluation, it can find and extract common part of different Deep Forest models (defined with bosk) and precompute its result for each train-test split. It allows to significantly speed up model comparison.

Submodules#

  • bosk.comparison.base
  • bosk.comparison.cross_val
  • bosk.comparison.metric

class bosk.comparison.BaseForeignModel#

Bases: abc.ABC

Adapter class for all models, defined outside of the bosk framework. It is needed to make sure that the model handles bosk’s style of the data transmission.

class bosk.comparison.BaseComparator(pipelines, foreign_models, f_optimize_pipelines=True, random_state=None)#

Bases: abc.ABC

Class that performes comparison of different models. The models, defined via bosk framework, marked as pipelines and may have a common part in them to optimize calculations (common part pipeline will be executed once and retreived data will be used in other pipelines). The common part must be a common begining of all pipelines.

The models, defined with others but bosk frameworks, are marked as models and must be wrapped in BaseForeignModel adapter to handle the bosk data transmission style.

Parameters:

  • pipelines (Optional[BasePipeline | List[BasePipeline]]) –

  • foreign_models (Optional[BaseForeignModel | List[BaseForeignModel]]) –

  • f_optimize_pipelines (bool) –

  • random_state (Optional[int]) –

class bosk.comparison.CVComparator(pipelines, foreign_models, cv_strat, exec_cls=TopologicalExecutor, exec_kw=None, get_blocks_times=False, suppress_exec_warn=True, f_optimize_pipelines=True, random_state=None)#

Bases: bosk.comparison.base.BaseComparator

Comparator that uses a cross-validation strategy of checking model’s performance. You can create your own iterator (based on sklearn’s BaseCrossValidator class) that will define indexes, taken in each fold, or you can use predefined iterators from the sklearn.

Parameters:

  • pipelines (Optional[BasePipeline | List[BasePipeline]]) – A pipeline or a list of pipelines to evaluate.

  • foreign_models (Optional[BaseForeignModel | List[BaseForeignModel]]) – A foreign model or a list of foreign models to evaluate.

  • cv_strat (sklearn.model_selection.BaseCrossValidator) – A cross-validation strategy to use.

  • exec_cls (Type[bosk.executor.base.BaseExecutor]) – The executor class to use.

  • exec_kw – The keyword arguments for the executor.

  • get_blocks_times (bool) – Whether to get block execution times. If True, the block executor will be changed to TimerBlockExecutor.

  • suppress_exec_warn (bool) – Whether to suppress warnings when using the executor.

  • f_optimize_pipelines (bool) – Whether to optimize pipelines.

  • random_state (Optional[int]) – The random state. It will be used as a seed for generator tu further propagate seeds to every block.

class bosk.comparison.MetricWrapper(func, y_true_name='y', y_pred_name='output', name=None)#

Bases: BaseMetric

Wrapper class for classic metric functions that take y_true as the first argument and y_pred as the second.

Parameters:

  • func (Callable[[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray], float]) – Function that accepts y_true and y_pred as arguments and returns a score.

  • y_true_name (str) – Name of the y_true.

  • y_pred_name (str) – Name of the y_pred.

  • name (Optional[str]) –

get_score(data_true, data_pred)#

Calculate the metric score given y_true and y_pred.

Parameters:

  • data_pred (Dict[str, bosk.data.BaseData]) – Dictionary containing the y_pred.
